qas.question: The earliest form of drama we know of was part of what culture?
Tragedy was a dramatic style that evolved from what?

answers.text: performance associated with religious and civic festivals

With the advent of newer technologies, scripts written for non-stage media have been added to this form. <b13_0><b15_0>War of the Worlds<b15_0/><b13_0/> (<a3_0>radio<a3_0/>) in <a4_0><b17_0>1938<b17_0/><a4_0/> saw the advent of literature written for <b7_0>radio broadcast,<b7_0/> and many works of Drama have been adapted for <b8_0><b14_0>film or television<b14_0/>.<b8_0/> Conversely, television, film, and radio literature have been adapted to <b9_0>printed or electronic media.
